articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of members of the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah, including fighters and medics, were seriously wounded on Tuesday when the pagers they use to communicate exploded, a security source told Reuters.
articles.title: Hundreds of Hezbollah members wounded in Lebanon when pagers explode, security source says

articles.author: Makini Brice, Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Dominique Pelicot, the Frenchman accused of drugging his wife and recruiting dozens of strangers to rape her over a decade, on Tuesday admitted to the various criminal charges he faces and begged his family's forgiveness, French media reported.
articles.title: Frenchman accused of mass abuse of wife says "I am a rapist", seeks forgiveness - media

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, Helen Coster, Tim Reid, Richard Cowan
articles.description: Two months after Donald Trump narrowly survived an assassination attempt, a gunman hid undetected for nearly 12 hours on the edge of the golf course where Trump played on Sunday under the protection of an agency that is being pushed to its limits.
articles.title: New apparent Trump assassination attempt highlights Secret Service strains

articles.author: Janis Laizans
articles.description: Rivers were still spilling banks in the Czech Republic, while the River Danube was rising in Slovakia and Hungary, and flooding has also affected Austria.
articles.title: Poland fortifies towns as deadly floods afflict central Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Tuesday it had repelled five new attempts by Ukrainian forces to smash through its border into the Kursk region, bringing the total number of reported attacks on the border to 26 in just the past six days.
articles.title: Russia says Ukraine has made new attempts to pierce its Western border

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: The head of Russia's nuclear testing site said on Tuesday his secretive facility was ready to resume nuclear tests "at any moment" if Moscow gave the order, in rare comments likely to fuel concerns that the risk of such a step is rising.
articles.title: Russian nuclear test chief says Moscow is ready to resume testing 'at any moment'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire broke out inside Greece's second biggest oil refinery on Tuesday, forcing workers to evacuate as a column of black smoke poured across the evening sky, authorities and the company said.
articles.title: Fire breaks out at Greek oil refinery near Athens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A 12-year-old boy stabbed and wounded at least five other pupils and a teacher at a school in Portugal on Tuesday, police said after taking the youngster into custody.
articles.title: Boy stabs, wounds at least five schoolmates, teacher in Portugal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs has been hit with three federal charges of racketeering conspiracy, sex trafficking and transportation to engage in prostitution, according to an indictment unsealed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs charged with racketeering, sex trafficking

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least eight people were killed and nearly 3,000 wounded when pagers used by Hezbollah members - including fighters and medics - detonated simultaneously across Lebanon.
articles.title: What we know so far about the deadly pager blasts in Lebanon?
